events.title: International law meant to limit effects of war at breaking point, study finds
events.description: Report covering 23 conflicts over last 18 months concludes more than 100,000 civilians have been killed as war crimes rage out of control An authoritative survey of 23 armed conflicts over the last 18 months has concluded that international law seeking to limit the effects of war is at breaking point, with more than 100,000 civilians killed, while torture and rape are committed with near impunity. The extensive study by the Geneva Academy of International Humanitarian Law and Human Rights describes the deaths of 18,592 children in Gaza, growing civilian casualties in Ukraine and an â€œepidemicâ€ of sexual violence in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Continue reading...

events.title: More than 200 killed in coltan mine collapse in eastern DRC, officials say
events.description: Rubaya mine produces about 15% of the worldâ€™s coltan, which is processed into tantalum, used in mobile phones More than 200 people were killed this week in a collapse at the Rubaya coltan mine in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo, Lumumba Kambere Muyisa, a spokesperson for the rebel-appointed governor of the province where the mine is located, told Reuters on Friday. Rubaya produces about 15% of the worldâ€™s coltan, which is processed into tantalum â€“ a heat-resistant metal that is in high demand by makers of mobile phones, computers, aerospace components and gas turbines. The site, where local people dig manually for a few dollars a day, has been under the control of the M23 rebel group since 2024. Continue reading...

events.title: Living hell of North Koreaâ€™s â€˜paradise on Earthâ€™ scheme back in spotlight in Japan
events.description: Plaintiffs in case say they were lured from Japan, exploited for labour and cut off from families for generations It has been more than six decades since Eiko Kawasaki left Japan to begin a new life in North Korea . Then 17, she was among tens of thousands of people with Korean heritage who had been lured to the communist state by the promise of a â€œparadise on Earthâ€. Instead, they encountered something closer to a living hell. They were denied basic human rights and forced to endure extreme hardship. Official promises of free education and healthcare plus guaranteed jobs and housing had been a cruel mirage. And to their horror, they were prevented from travelling to Japan to visit the families they had left behind. Continue reading...

events.title: Michael Jordan's 1998 NBA Finals sneakers sell for a record $2.2 million
events.description: In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship â€” and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction. The game-winning sneakers sold for $2.2 million at Sotheby's in New York on Tuesday, smashing the sneaker auction record of $1.47 million, set in 2021 by a pair of Nike Air Ships that Jordan wore earlier in his career.

events.title: Here's the real reason to turn on airplane mode when you fly
events.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode."

events.title: 'I was up to my waist down a hippo's throat.' He survived, and here's his advice
events.description: Paul Templer was living his best life.

events.title: Relaxed entry rules make it easier than ever to visit this stunning Asian nation
events.description: Due to its remoteness and short summer season, Mongolia has long been a destination overlooked by travelers.

events.description: Having lived in Beijing for almost 12 years, I've had plenty of time to travel widely in China.

events.title: Broadcaster James Valentine retires from ABC after nearly 40 years due to cancer
events.description: â€˜I need to focus on getting better, on being with family and friends and making sure that Iâ€™m giving my health my best shotâ€™, Afternoons host says Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates Get our breaking news email , free app or daily news podcast Broadcaster and saxophonist James Valentine is retiring from the ABC after almost 40 years, due to cancer, ending 25 years of hosting Sydneyâ€™s Afternoons program on ABC Radio. Valentine, 64, has been a fixture on the public broadcaster since he joined as host of the Afternoon Show for kids on ABC TV in 1987 after a decade of playing in bands including The Models. events.title: What does normal look like in Caracas one month after the Maduro operation?
events.description: Nearly a month after U.S. forces seized NicolÃ¡s Maduro, Caracas is settling into an uneasy normal, with major changes and lingering questions about what lasts and what comes next.

events.description: For decades, students at the Ecole Philippe Gaulier have been paying to bomb onstage. The goal isn't laughs â€” it's learning how to take the humiliation and keep going.

events.title: Ukraine: Raids in Germany over violation of Russia sanctions
events.description: Five men have been arrested in LÃ¼beck for allegedly exporting goods to Russian defense companies. Meanwhile, the Kremlin has said talks with Ukraine will continue in Abu Dhabi on Wednesday. DW has more.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.description: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: Venezuelan activist Javier Tarazona released after four years amid US pressure
events.description: Venezuelan human rights activist Javier Tarazona was released after more than four years in a Caracas prison as part of a government amnesty for political detainees. His release came following pressure from the US after last monthâ€™s removal of NicolÃ¡s Maduro. Dozens of other political prisoners have been freed under the initiative, though hundreds remain behind bars.

events.title: Epstein Files: Millions of new documents have been released
events.description: Millions of new pages, images, and videos tied to Jeffrey Epstein have been released by the US Department of Justice, shedding new light on his connections with powerful and well-known figures.

events.title: Epstein files renew scrutiny on UK Prince Andrew and other figures
events.description: Over 3 million Jeffrey Epstein documents were released, implicating high-profile figures from royalty, politics, and business. Latest revelations renew scrutiny on Prince Andrew, with PM Keir Starmer urging him to testify. Diplomat Peter Mandelson resigned over financial links, while Crown Princess Mette-Marit and Casey Wasserman apologized. Elon Musk denied visiting Epsteinâ€™s island, and references to Donald Trump reveal little new information.

events.title: Bad Bunny, Grammy champion and vocal opponent of ICE
events.description: Bad Bunny, a Grammy-winning Puerto Rican star and Billboardâ€™s 2025 Artist of the Year, rose to fame after his 2017 hit Soy Peor. A vocal critic of US immigration enforcement, he has avoided US tour dates, making his upcoming Super Bowl halftime show a high-profile and divisive choice.

events.title: Liam Conejo Ramos returns to Minnesota after release from ICE custody
events.description: After nearly two weeks in an ICE family detention center in Texas, a judge ordered the release of five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father.

events.title: Gaza's Rafah crossing with Egypt reopens for limited number of Palestinians
events.description: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.

events.title: Carlos Alcaraz beats Novak Djokovic in Australian Open to make history
events.description: Carlos Alcaraz has won his first Australian Open. At just 22 years old, he is the youngest player in history to win all four Grand Slam titles.

events.title: Bangladesh hands down jail sentences to former PM and her Labour MP niece
events.description: Bangladesh has sentenced former prime minister, Sheikh Hasina, and her niece, Labour MP Tulip Siddiq, to jail in a corruption probe.

events.title: Trump to close Kennedy Center for two years - sparking more controversy over DC venue
events.description: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.

events.title: Germany detains 5 men accused of illegally exporting goods to Russia
events.description: German authorities have detained five men accused of being part of a network that illegally exported goods to Russian defense companies after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine

events.title: Philippine vice president faces new impeachment bids after surviving attempt
events.description: Activists have filed two impeachment complaints against Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte, accusing her of large-scale corruption

events.title: Syrian rapper Al Darwish returns home after 13 years to perform in post-Assad Damascus
events.description: Hani Al Sawah, a rap artist known as Al Darwish, has returned to Syria after 13 years to perform his political songs for the first time without the Assad dynasty in power

events.description: Thirty days after the U.S. captured then-President NicolÃ¡s Maduro, Venezuela remains in turmoil

events.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum pledges to send humanitarian aid to Cuba
events.description: Trump said he asked the Mexican leader to suspend oil shipments to Cuba.

events.title: Venezuelan activist Javier Tarazona released from prison as US diplomat assumes post
events.description: Venezuelan human rights activist Javier Tarazona has been released from prison after the government promised to free political prisoners in an amnesty bill

events.title: Groundhog Day: Punxsutawney Phil makes 140th weather prediction
events.description: Punxsutawney Phil emerges for the 140th annual Groundhog Day celebration as thousands gather to hear his winter prediction on Gobbler's Knob.

events.title: Deputy AG denies 5-year-old, father has asylum claim after family released from ICE detention
events.description: Young boy detained by ICE with father returns to Minnesota after judge's ruling, as officials clash over family's immigration status and asylum case.

events.title: Israel, Egypt coordinate reopening of Rafah Crossing in test before Gaza residents allowed through
events.description: Israel and Egypt reopened the Rafah Crossing between Gaza and Egypt in a limited test on Sunday as part of the ongoing 20-point peace plan.

events.title: Hundreds of political prisoners in Venezuela could be released under new amnesty bill
events.description: Venezuela's acting president announces amnesty bill that could free hundreds of political prisoners, including opposition leaders and journalists.

events.title: Israel set to reopen Gazaâ€™s Rafah border crossing with Egypt for first time since May 2024
events.description: Israel announced that the Rafah border crossing between Egypt and the Gaza Strip will reopen "for limited movement of people only" on Sunday, Feb. 1.
